text: Table 2 Factors important during cardiopulmonary bypass in maternal cardiac surgery High pump flows (30-50% increase over non-pregnant state) Mean arterial/perfusion pressure >65 mm Hg for optimal uteroplacental perfusion Haematocrit >28% Limit hypothermia (<32Â°C associated with higher fetal mortality) Monitor fetal heart rate continuously Optimize acid-base, glucose, Pao,, and Paco,
